subject: Management
title: One-on-Ones That Work
description: Learn One-on-Ones That Work in one minute.

hook.text: A team lead held weekly one-on-ones for a year. Status updates only. No growth conversations ever.

buildup.text: Most one-on-ones become status meetings. They should be the primary venue for feedback and coaching.

discovery.text: Effective one-on-ones: 70% employee-driven, focused on growth, obstacles, and career development.

twist.text: A good one-on-one leaves the employee feeling heard and clear on what to work on. Status does neither.

climax.text: Ask: what's going well? What's blocking you? What feedback do you have for me? That's the format.

punchline.text: One-on-ones are for people, not projects. Use them that way.

quiz.question: What should one-on-one meetings focus on?
options: Employee growth, obstacles, and career development, not status updates
Detailed project status updates and deadline tracking
Manager's priorities and direction for the upcoming week
